name: 3D & Depth Sensing
description: Sector template for 3D imaging, stereoscopic vision, and depth sensing patents including structured light, ToF, and stereo vision.
contextDescription: 3D and depth sensing patents cover technologies for spatial perception in devices. Key areas include time-of-flight (ToF) sensors, structured light projection, stereo vision algorithms, LiDAR, and depth map processing. Applications span smartphones (Face ID), automotive (ADAS/autonomous driving), robotics, and AR/VR. Patents in this space often relate to Apple's Face ID technology, automotive sensing, and industrial automation.
scoringGuidance: ToF and structured light patents are heavily used in smartphone face unlock systems.
Automotive LiDAR and depth sensing is a rapidly growing market with significant licensing potential.
Consider both hardware (sensors, projectors) and algorithm (depth estimation, point cloud processing) patents.
Face ID/facial depth sensing patents may read on Apple, Samsung, and Android device implementations.
Robotics and industrial automation represent emerging high-value applications.

questions.question: What depth sensing method does this patent cover? Score based on market adoption: 1-3 for passive stereo only, 4-6 for single-sensor methods, 7-10 for ToF, structured light, or multi-modal approaches used in flagship devices.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the sensing method (ToF, structured light, stereo, LiDAR, etc.) and its industry adoption.

questions.question: How applicable is this patent to automotive ADAS or autonomous driving systems? Consider LiDAR, depth sensing, object detection, and 3D scene understanding.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess automotive applications. ADAS and autonomous driving are high-damages targets.

questions.question: Does this patent relate to mobile face unlock, facial recognition, or biometric depth sensing (Face ID-style technology)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Face unlock patents read on billions of smartphones. Assess relevance to Apple Face ID, Android face unlock.

questions.question: Does this patent address 3D point cloud generation, processing, or analysis? Consider depth map refinement, 3D reconstruction, and spatial data processing.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Point cloud processing is essential for AR, robotics, and autonomous systems.
